info.title: User Roles And Permissions
info.description:
## TMF API Reference : TMF 672 - User Roles And Permissions

This API is used to manage the user account with which the customer or staff can log-in and log-off the system and the permission for the user to enter or operate the special information.

get.description: This operation list or find Permission entities

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-separated properties to be provided in response

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Requested index for start of resources to be provided in response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Requested number of resources to be provided in response

X-Total-Count.description: Total number of items matching criteria

AssetGroup.description: Defines a group of assets (entities) to which access can be controlled. Specific subclasses allow definition in various ways (list of entities, queries, ownership by customer, etc.)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

AssetUserRole.description: The AssetUserRole is the detailed information concerning an individual user role

managedAssetGroup.description: List (explicit or implied) of entities managed by this user role assignment.

CheckPermission.description: The CheckPermission task entity verifies that the security principal in context can carry out the action. If permission is granted, 200 is returned, if denied, 403 is returned. If party role or user is present in input, these are used, otherwise the security principal is deduced from the HTTP Authorization header.

characteristic.description: Consider defining characteristic spec on Entitlement. Input: Additional information that might be needed for a particular entitlement. For example, if Action is GiveDiscount on Function: ProductOrderItem, a characteristic could be used to transmit the percentage discount being asked for.

entitlement.description: Input: the action and function whose permission is being tested. e.g. Action: Create, Function: ProductOffering

entity.description: Input: The specific entity for which permission is being tested. For example, if Action is Update and Function is Customer, this could hold reference to specific customer to be updated. Or, if Action is Create and Function is ProductOffering, this could hold the entire entity, so that the permission could be checked against the line of business

partyRole.description: Input: The party role whose permission is being tested, this is preferable to user, since permissions can apply to party roles even when they are not logged into a software system, such as on an IVR, or in a voice call to a service rep

user.description: Input: Information about the security principal whose permission is being tested. Ignored if partyRole is supplied

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

CheckPermission_Create.description:
The CheckPermission task entity verifies that the security principal in context can carry out the action. If permission is granted, 200 is returned, if denied, 403 is returned. If party role or user is present in input, these are used, otherwise the security principal is deduced from the HTTP Authorization header.
Skipped properties: id,href

characteristic.description: Consider defining characteristic spec on Entitlement. Input: Additional information that might be needed for a particular entitlement. For example, if Action is GiveDiscount on Function: ProductOrderItem, a characteristic could be used to transmit the percentage discount being asked for.

entitlement.description: Input: the action and function whose permission is being tested. e.g. Action: Create, Function: ProductOffering

entity.description: Input: The specific entity for which permission is being tested. For example, if Action is Update and Function is Customer, this could hold reference to specific customer to be updated. Or, if Action is Create and Function is ProductOffering, this could hold the entire entity, so that the permission could be checked against the line of business

partyRole.description: Input: The party role whose permission is being tested, this is preferable to user, since permissions can apply to party roles even when they are not logged into a software system, such as on an IVR, or in a voice call to a service rep

user.description: Input: Information about the security principal whose permission is being tested. Ignored if partyRole is supplied

PartyRoleRef.description: Party role reference. A party role represents the part played by a party in a given context.

name.description: The name of the referred party role.

partyId.description: The identifier of the engaged party that is linked to the PartyRole object.

partyName.description: The name of the engaged party that is linked to the PartyRole object.

Permission.description: The Permission resource represents the entitlement given by an individual (granter) to another individual (user) to get access to a set of his owned manageable assets. One single permission resource can hold information referring to privileges granted for multiple manageable assets.

creationDate.description: Date when the payment was performed

description.description: Text describing the contents of the payment

validFor.description: The period for which the permission is valid

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

The Permission resource represents the entitlement given by an individual (granter) to another individual (user) to get access to a set of his owned manageable assets. One single permission resource can hold information referring to privileges granted for multiple manageable assets.

validFor.description: The period for which the permission is valid

TimePeriod.description: A period of time, either as a deadline (endDateTime only) a startDateTime only, or both

endDateTime.description: End of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

startDateTime.description: Start of the time period, using IETC-RFC-3339 format

UserRole.description: A UserRole defines access levels to operate over a given function that can be included in an asset.

href.description: Unique URI used to access to the userRole resource

involvementRole.description: Indication of the part that a user plays in its involvement with a manageable asset (product, service or resource)

Error.description: Used when an API throws an Error, typically with a HTTP error response-code (3xx, 4xx, 5xx)
